title: How Many Calories in a Stick of Butter?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in stick of butter, including full nutrition breakdown like fat, sodium, and equivalents, plus tweaks and FAQs for better understanding.
h1: How Many Calories in a Stick of Butter?
assumptions: Standard US stick (113 g or 1/2 cup), unsalted butter at room temperature.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, fat content, salted/unsalted, and storage; check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One stick of butter contains about 810 calories, primarily from saturated fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to light butter (reduced fat, ~40% less calories)
Use salted butter (adds salt but same calories)

faqs.q: How many calories in a stick of butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 810 calories for a standard 113 g stick.

faqs.q: Is butter high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, one stick has about 58 g of saturated fat, over 80% of its calories.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a stick of butter?
faqs.a: Around 91.5 g total fat, with no carbs or significant protein.

faqs.q: Does salted butter have more calories than unsalted?
faqs.a: No, calories are the same; salt only increases sodium to about 1,100 mg per stick.

faqs.q: What about calories in half a stick of butter?
faqs.a: Half a stick (56.5 g) has roughly 405 calories.
